description: Erection of a fourth storey to provide eight flats, replacement of windows, erection of 36 balconies to the first and second floor elevations, rendering and feature wall sections to existing elevations and extension of canopy to the main entrance
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - No development shall take place until samples and details of the materials for the treatment of the roof extension have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 3 - No development shall take place until samples and details of the materials for the treatment of the feature walls on the north elevation, south west corner and above the entrance have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in consultation with the BCC.

Condition : 4 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (4920IN00, 01A, 02A, 03A, 04, 05, 06 received 09/01/2015, 4920DE10A, 11C, 12C, 13C, 14F, 15E, 16H, 17G, 18D, 19D, 20G, 21G, 236A, 237A, 238A received 03/06/2015) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 5 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 7 - The windows on the west and east elevations marked as obscure glazed on the drawings shall be obscure glazed and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured glazing.

Condition : 8 - Within three months of work starting on site a Design Stage certificate and summary score sheet under the Code for Sustainable Homes (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that a Level 4 (minimum score 68) rating will be achieved.

Condition : 9 - Prior to first occupation of the dwelling(s) a Post Construction Review certificate and summary score sheet under the Code for Sustainable Homes (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that a Level 4 (minimum score 68) rating has been achieved.

Condition : 10 - The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy (NRG Consulting, December 2014) and shall not commence above ground until full Design Stage calculations under the Standard Assessment Procedure have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local planning Authority to show that the development will be constructed in accordance with the Energy Strategy and any subsequent approved revisions.

Condition : 11 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and as-built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy (NRG Consulting, December 2014) and any subsequent approved revisions.

Condition : 12 - No dwelling shall be occupied until arrangements have been agreed in writing with the local planning authority and put in place to ensure that, with the exception of disabled persons, no resident of the development shall obtain a resident's parking permit within any controlled parking zone which may be in force in Brentford at any time.
